65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:12): interesting ideas, I'm not sure I can fully agree with a native app being a Web app
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:12): I think to be considered a Web app, you have to not just use URIs but be URI addressable
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (00:13): which was ben's point

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:15): I suppose the cynical interpretation is "I'm supposed to be promoting android now  so I have to say that native apps are good and not anti-web". But I have no real reason to believe that the cynical reason is the corect one
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:15): Ben's point was stronger - not only does your app need to be URI-addressable, but at least some places inside it should be URI-addressable
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:15): which would exclude most Flash on the Web
b5934067b4c7d9c30299478a245d4491 (00:16): a web app should be in the web, not merely on the web?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:16): that was Ben Ward's argument
b5934067b4c7d9c30299478a245d4491 (00:16): it's also the classic argument for RDF :)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:16): Tim's position seems to be that a web app doesn't even have to be on the Web, it just needs to link to the web
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:17): Arguably he is allow allowing for the possibility of creating or modifying resources
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:18): But yeah, I wouldn't consider something that can read or modify the web to necessarily be a part of the web
